meanings.definition: To place or set in position beforehand.
meanings.sent1: She preplaced the books on the shelf before the library opened.
meanings.sent2: The workers preplaced the equipment for the event.
meanings.sent3: The students preplaced their snacks in their bags for the field trip.
meanings.sent4: He preplaced his tools in the toolbox like a puzzle master.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces were preplaced on the table, waiting to be put together.

meanings.definition: Positioned or set in place beforehand.
meanings.sent1: The preplaced chairs were ready for the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The preplaced decorations made the room festive.
meanings.sent3: The preplaced snacks tempted the hungry guests.
meanings.sent4: The preplaced obstacles challenged the racers on the course.
meanings.sent5: The preplaced signs guided the way through the maze.
